column4: is there a way for me to view the windows partitions from linux?
Just make sure you are here enough to help others
ntfs is the files system Windows XP uses
it should all be in that link ubotu posted
If you have a seperate partition for just music, you might want to consider formating in fat32.  Both Linux and Windows can read/write to fat32
if it is the same partition as windows, dont bother
back up your music, when you format you erase everything on that partition
no time is better then now
wiki.ubuntu.com, that site has alot of help to offer
search that site from now on to see if you can answer yourself
